content.question: Hide paintings such as those produced by Cotsiogo (Cadzi Cody) in the late 1800s were important to Shoshone artists in part because of the response the hide paintings got from

choices.label: Euro-American tourists, who were eager to buy them
national museums, which sought them for growing collections
other Shoshone, who wore them during ceremonies
tribal leaders, who wanted them for recording events

content.answer: Euro-American tourists, who were eager to buy them

topic.text: 5.3: Purpose and Audience in Indigenous American Art

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Explain how artistic decisions about form, style, materials, content, function, and/or context of a work of art (or group of related works of art) elicit a response or shape its reception.
